DOC.brief_summary: This study is a randomized trial to test whether a decision aid can help to improve the quality of decision making about feeding options in care of patients with dementia.
DOC.brief_title: Improving Decision Making About Feeding Options for Dementia
DOC.detailed_description: This research study is a cluster randomized controlled trial of a decision aid to improve decision-making about feeding options for patients with advanced dementia. Surrogate decision-makers in the nursing homes randomized to the intervention will review the decision aid and be prompted to discuss it with the primary health care provider, while those in the control sites receive usual care. We measure the immediate, 1 and 3 month effects of the decision aid on the quality of surrogate decision-making for nursing home residents with advanced dementia.
DOC.criteria: dementia diagnosis advanced cognitive impairment feeding problem age >= 65 surrogate decision maker feeding tube decision made hospice BMI > 26 major psychosis or developmental delay
